response.answer_text: Yes, No and I’m not sure. I’m 66 and here’s what I’ve found. The No’s: Physically, the aging process is something you cannot stop. You can do things to lessen the problems and symptoms but aches and pains creep up on you (at least they have for me). My eyesight has deteriorated a lot — without my glasses I have double vision. My strength has lessened and it’s more difficult to get the top of the pickel jar off. Good sleep tends to elude me — I wake up around 3:00 a.m. every morning and have trouble getting back to sleep. Working is much more tiresome than it was before and by Friday, I’m exhausted. I’d love to retire, but am not ready to drastically change my lifestyle to do so. I find I have anger I didn’t used to have—like a lifetime of slights all of a sudden built up. This is the main thing that affects my life negatively, and I find myself constantly battling it. The Yes’s: I’m more grounded. I’m calmer about just about everything. I find time for hobbies I love and didn’t take time for when I was younger. I’m less competitive and more accepting of my faults. I’m more patient. I take more time to stop and smell the roses. I lead a healthier lifestyle and experience very little stress (with the exception of lack of money). The “I’m not sure’s”: I simply will not take crap from anyone anymore. While I deal with it as politely as I can, I won’t stand back and say nothing like I used to. This doesn’t go over well with most people. SO - it’s a mixed bag and I can’t answer a definitive yes or no.
